children.text: is resurfacing some of our most important efforts of 2022. Today, we focus on the launch of our current lineup of podcasts this year. We will return to our normal publishing schedule in the new year.

children.html: In the meantime, are you ready to hold the powerful accountable in 2023? If you appreciate this reporting, please click here for a major year-end discount to become a supporting subscriber to help us do more of this work in the new year. And remember, when you subscribe, you get all sorts of exclusive stuff, including access to our live events, our premium podcasts, our Citizens Guide To Holding The Powerful Accountable, and more.

Your paid subscription has funded The Lever’s independent investigative journalism this year. We can’t thank you enough. If you wish to help us go even further in 2023, consider upgrading to a Lever Leader subscription, which comes with an annual special gift, a personal call-out in an upcoming post, a free gift subscription, access to an exclusive sneak peek at the organization’s future plans, and more.

Even if you don’t upgrade, we deeply thank you for your support — we couldn’t do this work without you.

children.text: This has been a truly historic year for
: Our staff has almost doubled in size, we produced more original reporting than ever before, and we launched
We began in June with the launch of
, our flagship podcast hosted by myself.

has given us the chance to amplify our work to an entirely new audience, bringing our original reporting to podcast players around the world. In just nine short months, we’ve interviewed dozens of journalists, industry experts, entertainers, and politicians. This includes actress Susan Sarandon, Amazon Labor Union president Chris Smalls, MSNBC host Chris Hayes, Planned Parenthood president Alexis McGill-Johnson, famed environmental lawyer Steven Donziger, director Judd Apatow, and U.S. Sens. Sheldon Whitehouse and Brian Schatz.
which is exclusively available for supporting subscribers, we produced a variety of bonus segments. That included interviews with climate futurist Alex Steffen,

children.html: You can get access to Lever Time Premium right now by becoming a paid subscriber with a major year-end discount of nearly 40% off. Click here to claim this discount and get immediate access.

children.text: In October, we launched our second podcast,
, hosted by comedian Dave Anthony and Oscar-nominated screenwriter Josh Olson.

is a humorous and informative look at how powerful people attempt to launder their histories and reputations through supposedly educational content. In the duo’s first mini-season, they audited the entirety of President George W. Bush’s MasterClass (and somehow made it out alive). In their current mini-season, the hosts are joined by Senator Nina Turner, and the study group is trudging their way through political consultants David Axelrod and Karl Rove’s joint MasterClass on campaign strategy.
We’re extremely proud of the podcasts we’ve produced this year as

continues to build an alternative to corporate media. If you haven’t gotten a chance yet, learn how to sign up for our podcasts below. Also, keep your eyes peeled in 2023 for some new exciting podcasts as we continue to expand our podcast network.
comes out every Wednesday morning and features exclusive reporting from The Lever’s newsroom, high-profile guest interviews, and expert analysis from the sharpest minds in media and politics.

Hosted by comedian and WGA-nominated TV writer Dave Anthony and Oscar-nominated screenwriter Josh Olson,

is an “educational” series in which Dave and Josh audit a variety of online classes, docuseries, and other media products created by noxious political figures and boil them down to the good stuff. By which they mean… the bad stuff. An episode of
is like listening to a book report  — except all the authors are deranged lunatics poisoning American culture.
